channel.title: Contributions to Academia | Katja Kero's homepage

item.title: Activities in the Academic Community
item.description:
Mannerheim League for Child Welfare, Littoinen

  • Member of the Board 2008–2012

The Finnish Gynecological Association

  • Secretary 2016–2017

The Committee for the Promotion of Sexual and Reproductive Health in Finland Proper

  • Chairman 2020–2021
  • Vice-Chairman 2016–2019
  • Member of the Board 2015–2019

The Sexual Health Group of the Finnish Gynecological Association

  • Chairman 2018–

The Finnish Gynecological Association’s Sexual Health Group

  • Member of the Board 2010–

The Finnish Society of Sexual Medicine

  • Member of the Board 2018–2022

The Nordic Society of Sexual Medicine

  • Member of the Board 2022–
  • Vice President 2023–
  • President 2024–

The HPV Coalition

  • Member
    The coalition is founded by experts and a patient organization, whose goal is to promote Finland’s commitment to the EU’s cancer control plan’s goal of eradicating cancers caused by HPV.

The Korento ry

  • Expert member / “godmother”
    Korento ry is a national patient organization that represents up to 200,000 Finns living with endometriosis, adenomyosis, PCOS, and vulvodynia.

The Gynecological Cancer Patients Association of Finland

  • Expert member

item.title: Research Grants
item.description:
Individual Grants

The Cancer Foundations of South-Western Finland

  • 4,000 €

The Cancer Foundations of Finland

  • 3,400 €

The Finnish Gynaecological Society

  • 4,000 €

The Finnish Medical Foundation

  • 2,500 €
  • 4,000 €

The Finnish Society Against Sexually Transmitted Diseases

  • 3,000 €

National Graduate School of Clinical Investigation

  • 3,500 € (2 months)

The Government Special Foundation (EVO) to Turku University Hospital

  • 14,000 € (4 months)

Orion-Pharmos Research Foundation

  • 3,000 €

Project-Based Grants

Implementation of Education of Sexual Medicine in Finnish Medical Schools

The Finnish Medical Foundation:

  • 3,000 € for the study of developing education of Sexual Medicine for Medical Schools (2019, research project).
  • 3,500 € for the study of developing education of Sexual Medicine for Medical Schools (2021, producing lectures and other materials for the Medical Schools of Finland).

Vaginal and Oral Microbiota (“EMMI”)

  • The Cancer Foundations of South-Western Finland: 8,500 € (12/2016)
  • The Government Special Foundation (EVO) to Turku University Hospital: 5,000 € (12/2016)
  • The Finnish Cultural Foundation: 24,000 € for DNA analyses (5/2020)

Eradicating Domestic Violence (EHYEKSI-hanke)

  • Päivikki and Sakari Sohlberg Foundation: 15,000 €

item.title: Supervision of Licentiate Theses
item.description:
1. Pajula Elina: Fysioterapian merkitys vulvodynian hoidossa.
    The significance of physiotherapy in the treatment of vulvodynia. (2012)

  2. Holmi Raija: Seksuaalilääketieteen opetus Turun yliopiston lääkärikoulutuksessa vuonna 2012.
    Teaching sexual medicine in medical education at the University of Turku in 2012. (2012)

  3. Eklund Tero, Salmenhaara Lasse: Menopeli - perille vaihdevuosista.
    Menopeli - A journey through menopause. (2014)

  4. Korhonen Julia: Sukuelinalueen lichen planus.
    Lichen planus in the genital area. (2015)

  5. Särkilä Hanna: Botuliinitoksiinin käyttö vulvodynian ja vaginismin hoidossa.
    The use of botulinum toxin in the treatment of vulvodynia and vaginismus. (2016)

  6. Torala Eini: Ovatko yksityisen lääkäriaseman tekemät lähetteet turhia? – Adenova -lääkärikeskuksen lähetekäytäntö 2012–2013.
    Are referrals made by private medical clinics unnecessary? – Referral practices at Adenova Medical Center 2012–2013. (2017)

  7. Leminen Johanna: Turun yliopistollisen keskussairaalan naistenklinikan lääkärien ja hoitajien suhtautuminen lähisuhdeväkivallan seulontatyöhön.
    Attitudes of physicians and nurses at the Women’s Clinic of Turku University Hospital toward screening for intimate partner violence. (2020)

  8. Grönlund Jarna: Seksuaalilääketieteen opetus Suomessa. Kansallinen kysely gynekologeille.
    Teaching sexual medicine in Finland – A national survey of gynecologists. (2020)

  9. Kevo Lotta: Seksuaalilääketieteen opetus ja osaaminen Suomessa: kysely viimeisen vuoden lääketieteen opiskelijoille.
    Teaching and competence in sexual medicine in Finland: A survey for final-year medical students.

  10. Aaltonen Henrika: Emättimen normaalin mikrobiston koostumus, siihen vaikuttavat tekijät ja mikrobiston muutosten rooli gynekologisten sairauksien taustalla.
    The composition of the normal vaginal microbiota, influencing factors, and the role of microbial changes in gynecological diseases. (2020)

  11. Vihlman Eerika: Seksuaali- ja lisääntymisterveyden opetus ja osaaminen Suomessa – kysely valmistuville kätilöopiskelijoille.
    Teaching and competence in sexual and reproductive health in Finland – A survey for graduating midwifery students. (2023)

  12. Kultti Pihla: Turun yliopistollisen keskussairaalan toimialueiden tarjoamien seksuaalineuvontapalveluiden tilanne vuonna 2022.
    The status of sexual counseling services offered by departments at Turku University Hospital in 2022. (2023)

item.title: Supervision of PhD Theses
item.description:
Completed Theses

TtM Sanna-Mari Manninen

“Sexual Education in Finland: A National Survey among Medical Students and General Practitioners”
Completed her PhD on 8.5.2024 at the University of Turku.

Current Supervisions

LL Anna Aromaa’s Dissertation

“Do Gynecologists Talk about Sexual Health? Attitudes, Perceived Barriers, Practice Patterns and Education of Sexual Medicine in Finland: A National Survey among Gynecologists and Obstetricians”

  • The first partial publication published.
  • The second publication submitted to an international peer-reviewed journal.

LK Viivi Virkkunen’s Doctoral Thesis

“The connection of vascular health, physical activity and fitness to women’s sexual function in women of retirement age and the effect of retirement on women’s sexual function”

  • First partial publication published in a peer-reviewed journal.
  • The second publication submitted.
